frameDefinitions: In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the duration of an Event.
In this frame a Deformer deforms a Patient possibly against a Resistant_surface such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the Configuration, a new shape.

This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2).
These words refer to separating a Whole into Parts, or separating one part from another.
The Borrower takes possession of a Theme with the knowledge that the Borrower will have to give the Theme back to the Lender after a Duration of time.
An  Agent or non-human Cause causes an Item to change its physical size.
frameExamples: Don't let him <t>prolong</t> the discussion to an absurd length.
Ellen <t>crumpled</t> the paper into a ball.
The company is <t>raising</t> the final dividend from 4.34p to 4.57p, to boost the total by 5.3 percent to 6.36p.
I <t>divided</t> the class into groups in alphabetical order .
I am <t>borrowing</t> the book about modal particles from the professor.
If the design crashes too often, then try <t>lengthening</t> the wings by a few centimeters, to perhaps 30cm total.  CNI INI
listRoleDefinitions: The sentient entity that changes the duration of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen>'s duration is changed.
An event that causes the change in Event duration.
The time at which the change in duration of the Event is caused.
The <fen>Deformer</fen> is the one who does the reshaping.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity acted on and that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
A state that holds of the <fen>Patient</fen> or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the <fen>Patient</fen> as a result of the arranging action.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies when the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the <fen>Deformer</fen> intentionally affects the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The person who causes an entity (Item) to change its positon on a scale with respect to some property (Variable).
The scale along which the <fen>Item</fen> ranges in value.
The entity whose position along a scale is being changed.
The force that causes the change.
When the event occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the value of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into <fen>Parts</fen>.  It is usually the NP Object of a target verb.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb.
<fen>Part_2</fen> is the second of two <fen>Parts</fen> mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First,
With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something.  The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument:
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-agent that brings about the separation.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
The person who receives the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The person or institution who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The object that the <fen>Borrower</fen> receives from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
When the borrowing even occurs.
The location in which the <fen>Borrower</fen> gets the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen>.
With some words in this frame, an <fen>Agent</fen> who causes the change in size of the <fen>Item</fen> may be present. The <fen>Agent</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument of a verb.
The <fen>Item</fen> is frequently the External Argument of verbs or the NP Object if an <fen>Agent</fen> is expressed.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is a non-human entity which brings about the change in size.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Item</fen> to expand.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> cause the expansion of the <fen>Item</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Don't let <fex>him</fex> prolong the discussion to an absurd length.
Don't let him prolong <fex>the discussion</fex> to an absurd length.
<fex>Rain</fex> so cruelly cut short the game against Bangladesh.
<fex>Last week</fex>, he unnecessarily prolonged the agony, thinking that he could tough it out.
<fex>The lieutenant</fex> crushed it angrily with his boot before looking back at Hencke.
Jack plucked the flower out of his morning coat and closed his fist slowly over it , crushing <fex>it</fex> into a pulp.
<fex>The strong winds</fex> deformed the structure of the outhouse.
The lieutenant crushed it angrily with his boot <fex>before looking back at Hencke</fex>.
They increased <fex>the price of oil</fex>.
<fex>Oil</fex> prices were raised yesterday.
<fex>The rain</fex> increased the river's flow rate to an astonishing million gallons per second.
As a result, they raised prices <fex>in Peoria</fex>.
The directors split <fex>the company</fex> in two.
The directors split the company <fex>in two</fex>.
First, separate <fex>the yolks</fex> from the whites.
separate the yolks <fex>from the whites</fex>.
<fex>The researcher</fex> divided subjects into groups.
I divided the prize money among the winners <fex>that night</fex>.
You should separate the yolks from the whites <fex>over the sink</fex>.
<fex>Tracy</fex> borrowed that book from Leonard last week.
Tracy borrowed that book <fex>from Leonard</fex> last week.
I am borrowing his car <fex>at the airport</fex>.
<fex>Management</fex> expanded the company.
<fex>The company</fex> expanded.
